channel.title: [ compiler problem ]
channel.description:
Hey, I was trying out a new source, and I used the compiler, and this came up.
[code]javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
This is my compiler code.
[code]@echo off title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause cls Compiler.bat pause [/code]
Is there any way I can fix this? Note: I [b][i][u]AM[/u][/i][/b] using Jdk1.6.0_03.
Thanks for any help!

item.title: [ compiler problem ]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Thank you. Since you’re 200 rep, I can’t rep you anymore. =]

item.title: [ compiler problem ]
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

It has the JDK working, it just can’t find any Java files to compile. His compiler isn’t in his server folder or he has a source that runs from class files.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Sir_Chase wrote:

get the jdk update 11 download and install it and run the JDK wizard with it.thats what i did

item.title: [ compiler problem ]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Hey, I was trying out a new source, and I used the compiler, and this came up.

javac: file not found: *.java Usage: javac <options> <source files> use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

This is my compiler code.

@echo off title Compiler "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause cls Compiler.bat pause

Is there any way I can fix this?
Note: I AM using Jdk1.6.0_03.

Thanks for any help!
